column4: what pcmcia wireless card is going to work with the new release out of the box?
I'm bashing my head against a wall with the Dlink DWL-650revP
mine does -- linksys something-or-other; I'll tell you if you're interested
yea mate please do
exact model/revision please
Linksys WPC11
although I dimly recall that there's more than one version of it
yeah that's the problem
I've been reading about the dlink 650 for the last two days
there are 4 revisions and all have different chipsets
I'm using Ubuntu precisely because it's the first distro i found which works with that card out of the box :-)
I still can't confirm what chipset mine has
yeah I hear that...for me wifi is the deal breaker with desktop linux
I can't be spending two days trying to debug pcmcia/cardbus issues
I can assure you this card was very cheap -- so even if your current card doesn't work, if you buy the other kind it probably will
the docs for that shit suck so much as it is
alright I'll look for it
I don't even remember where I got it.
find some store that will let you return the card if it doesn't work.
oh yeah of course
I might just go buy one of every card
keep the one that works
return all the rest
if you can do that, that's great!
